39330574.review:
国盗りアクションストラテジーゲーム。
プレイヤーは戦場指揮官となり、敵味方の大量のキャラが入り乱れる戦場を戦い領地を広げていくストラテジー要素のあるアクションだ。ゲーム進行はフィールドマップと戦場マップに分かれており、フィールドマップで部隊の移動や内政、味方のナイトへの命令を行い、敵部隊と遭遇または拠点の争奪戦になると戦場マップに移行する形式になっている。イメージ的には"Mount&Blade"を2Dにしたようなものだ。

[基本アクション]
攻撃ボタンは2種類あり、敵キャラにボタンを押す順番が表示されているので、2つのボタンをその表示の通りに押して攻撃することで倒すことができる。正しく攻撃ボタンを押さないとダメージは入らない。敵のナイトには防御方向もあるので、その方向以外の向きから攻撃しなければならない。その他の基本アクションとしては、ダッシュ(回避)とカウンター(スタン攻撃)がある。
また、死亡するとQTE入力になり何度か成功するとその場で復活できる。失敗した場合はしばらく時間をおいて初期位置からにリスポーンし、味方の兵士が全滅しない限り復活できる。

[コンボ]
コンボウィンドウを開くと使用出来るスキルが表示され、使用したいスキルのコマンドを入力するとコンボゲージを消費してスキルを発動できる。
コンボウィンドウを表示しているときにはスロー状態となり落ち着いて入力することができる。ただし、NewGame+ではスロー状態にならない。

[戦場指揮]
味方の部隊が4分割されて、それぞれにウェイポイントを設定して移動先を命令できる。村や砦での戦闘ではウェイポイントを設定しないと味方が移動してくれない。

[増援]
戦場での戦闘が長引くと、敵味方の増援がどんどんやってきて大規模になっていく。

[内政]
城や砦、村を3段階強化できる。主に村は収入、砦は防衛のためのもので、領地の村と砦を攻略しないと攻城戦をすることができない。城を奪取することでその領地の所有権が決まる。これらの自軍の拠点では兵士を預けたり引き受けたりすることが可能で、城ではナイトの雇用ができる。
また、自軍領地には戦場で自動支援攻撃してくれる攻城兵器や、金や人を供給してくれる鉱山やギルドを建設することができ、これらも3段階強化できる。

[味方のナイト]
城で雇用できる味方のユニットで自動で行動するが、この領地を防衛、あの領地を攻撃と大雑把な命令をすることができる。戦闘を繰り返し10段階成長する。プレイヤーが戦闘しているときに近くにいれば増援として参戦してくる。

ゲームシステム的に遊べる要素が多いが、それを活かせるようなバランスにはなっていないような印象を受ける。価格相応な内容だ。
例えば、攻撃ボタン2つの組み合わせで攻撃するのは良いが、敵の数が多くなってくると面倒になって攻撃ボタンを交互に連射するだけになりがちだ。また、スキルが多く用意されているが比較的に早く後半のスキルが取れてしまうために中途半端なスキルは死にスキルになってしまうなど、バランス面では今一つに思える。特に後半は、スーパーセルフ(一定時間無敵で無双するスキル)を使用して、ひたすらボタン連打することが多いと思う。
ただ、プレイヤーキャラ1人で敵を100人以上倒せる割に、1人で不用意に敵の大軍に突っ込むとあっさり死ぬことがあり、スキルは強いがキャラの防御力自体はそれほどでもないところは良いと思う。味方の兵士が全滅すると戦場で復活できないので、どんなに奮戦しても圧倒的な数の差は覆せないことがあり戦いは数だということを感じさせてくれるところは良い。
ゲームシステムは良いがどうしても単調なプレイになりやすいゲームだと思う。人によっては飽きが早く来るかもしれないが、内容を許容できるならクリアまでは楽しめると思う。セールで買うのならオススメだ。

Приблизительно  такая  завязка  у  данной  маленькой,  но  симпатичной  игрушки,  которую  можно  условно  разделить  на  две  части:  боевую  и  стратегическую. На  общей  же  карте  королевства  предстоит  отвоёвывать  регионы,  захватывая  замки,  сторожевые  вышки  и  деревни,  а  также  руководить  строительством  вербовочных  центров,  рудников  и  требушетов.  Присутствует  набор  опыта  и  повышение  уровней,  вражеские  и  свои  рыцари,  караваны  для  разграбления  и  прочие  маленькие  плюшки.  В  целом  «Hyper  Knights»  неплохо  подходит  для  того,  чтобы  занять  несколько  часов  свободного  времени.

Плюсы:  играется  бодро.

Минусы:  повторяющийся  процесс.

38075117.review:
I drank a bunch of coffee and then played this. Makes me feel like a coked up hummingbird of death, especially when I use Super Self.

Larger battles can cause a lot of lag and start dropping frames, which makes the game a lot less fun. It's more demanding on your computer than you might think, given the way it looks.

I managed to unlock all the abilities in about 4 hours. May have some limited replay value, especially with workshop support.

A few tips:

- Don't ignore Flurry. It's absurdly good at taking out enemy knights.

- Seems that losing all of your units will cause you to lose the battle, even if you're still alive. On the other hand, enemy knights have to be killed to win the battle. This can be frustrating, since they respawn. It's worth taking them out early, but can often be better to just save them for last, after all of their units are dead. 

- Make sure to recruit all knights from castles, and upgrade everything in each region you conquer. It's also worth transferring troops to border regions yourself to reinforce them against counterattack.

- When you take a new region, don't forget to give your knights new orders. If you don't, the ones that were attacking that region will actually go back to the previous territory and not even defend your new conquest.

35952362.review:
Hyper Knights is a surprisingly fun, mindless button masher that is some kind of frankenstein stich up between games like Dynasty Warriors, Mount and Blade: Warband, Shadow of Mordor, and even One Finger Death Punch for good measure. It bases it's difficulty and power curve on an admittedly very shallow foundation of mashing the right buttons to kill and gaining experience to improve your character.

The good thing though is that the price justifies the game experience you get. It's a shallow but very fun game that doesn't overstay it's welcome. Could it be more polished? Certainly, but that's not really the point. I'd have been happy to buy the game for $10, for $5 I'd say it's a real steal for the unique gameplay it offers.

35442473.review: Bought it on sale for a pittance and at first I didn't get it, but soon I was hooked. Time flew by. I could swear I only fought one battle  and yet when I looked at the clock it was 35 minutes later. No matter what you do there's going to be a lot of button mashing. Its clever that they actually put the XY marks on all the enemies. Odd, clumsy controls for directing troops to new locations. The mouse is so much better at accuracy. The battles are repetetive as is the scenery and the appearance of troops knights. It just isn't important if you have the button layout to kill the unit floating above his head. The repetition does get tedious, but it takes awhile. It took a lot longer in Mount and Blade because you had things like riding a horse and shooting a bow from your horse to distract you. The very quick action means that there isn't much time to place things or think about stuff, but the great thing about Hyper Knights is that it doesn't annoy you by making you watch actors act. It just lets you get right into the action. 35115902.review:
很有意思的游戏。看了王老菊的视频然后来买了玩。

游戏一开始要我们自己上，占据领地，然后慢慢的扩张我们的势力。玩法很有意思，按键来消灭敌人，所以如果手速够快就可以斩敌无数。特别是suuperself和superslash，证明了天下武功唯快不破。后期拥有了自己的骑士团以后可以指挥他们去收复失地，还可以把他们一起叫上打群架，场面蔚为壮观，几千士兵把电脑卡死：）。

几点建议，一个是这类游戏必须后期要增加的一点，就是地图的自定义化，比如地图随机构成，地图大小调控，这样会有更高的游戏性，毕竟如果永远只是一个地图的话，那么玩法和侵略方向大致是不会变的。（我第二次new game+的时候是直接200士兵冲到对面老家开打，敌军无限聚集，每次被打败之后再回家点兵再回去干架，很爽。不过家里一样要招骑士团，侵略和发展。）

第二个，就是兵种可以增加，毕竟如果战场上有长矛兵，炮车，攻城弩，甚至说超能力者（比如亡灵法师 元素法师等等）那么游戏战斗就不会千篇一律，整体感官会非常棒。从这我们可以引出一点就是在游戏中增加一个很有意思的东西，那就是科技树。你可以选择点科技或是魔法，科技侧发展到后面也可以有坦克，战斗机等等，魔法侧就可以有元素法师，亡灵控制，牧师和战场法师等等。

第三个就是AI的难度了。其实讲道理这个游戏除了荒地英雄之战以外，其他的攻城站和侵略战一般是不会失败的。而在开阔地区发生的战役完全就是比拼谁的军队多，谁的援兵来的快。因为虽然我们自己的英雄不会死的很快，但是如果我们不能快速清理大波兵线的话，那么等到我们军队死完以后我们就输了。

总之游戏很有意思，推荐打折入手，期待后续更新。

34741667.review:
Best medieval windshield wiper simulation ever.

Hyper Knights is a fun little game, however overwhelmed by annoying flaws which mar the overall enjoyment. 


Pros:
+ Fun
+ Addictive
+ Simple
+ Great controls (provided you play with a controller)
+ Achievements do not require grinding or restarting everything with a new difficulty

Cons:
- Painfully repetitive
- A nightmare to play without a controller
- No overall control on the grand strategy scheme
- The strategy component in battles is more than thin
- Artificial ways to increase the lifetime of this game
- A myriad of annoying things (detailed below)

Verdict: Fun, but flawed, and the flaws tend to overcome the fun. 

Description: In this game you are a knight who wants to take back his land. The land is divided into regions. Each regions has different buildings (villages, which produce resources, outposts, which are fortified, and a central castle). You must destroy all before being allowed to take the castle. Each encounter with an enemy unit or building triggers a small battle. You thus go back and forth between the grand strategy map and the skirmishes. 

In skirmishes you control your knight and you are followed by your army. Once all soldiers of your army are dead, you loose the battle. You win the battle once all enemy buildings and units are down. In the grand strategy map, you can recruit knights which can lead additional armies, give instructions to the knights (attack this region or defend this one), which they loosely follow, and build some useless buildings. Overall it's pretty bland and the core of the game are the battles. 

Flaws:

- In battles, the enemy leaders (knights) respawn after some time (just as yourself). The problem is, several knights can join the battle. At some point, the knights become extremely tough, so that the time you need to kill them all  (knowing that they are invulnerable to your soldiers arrows, have health regeneration and can heal themselves) is smaller than the respawn time of the others. In short, even if you have max soldiers and you killed all enemy units save the knights, you cannot win. This is all the more unfair since if all your soldiers die, you loose the battle no matter what (last man standing is not an option): this should have been the same for the enemy. 

- The game is awfully repetitive. Once you have taken back a region, you have taken back them all. Eve the ultimate last castle is the same as all others. No boss, no specific architecture... You have basically five kinds of maps (simple skirmish, convoy attack, outpost, village, castle). The simple skirmish is a mere rectangle were both armies appear on opposite sides. 

- Many elements of the game are completely useless. It is enlightening to see which are the achievements obtained by the fewest people. They involve the use of all super powers (you only need about five of them out of ten), convoys attacks (a complete waste of time since aiming straight for buildings spare you more identical battles) and stunning enemy units (it is faster to kill them). 

- You can fight by striking enemies according to a sequence of X and Y appearing above them. However, they can stun you and if you are facing about ten of them at the same time, you die in seconds (even at max level). You need to rely on your combos which are basically super-powers (a blue bar fills up with time and is consumed whenever they are used). Some of them are incredibly powerful (e.g. kill all enemies on a radius bigger than screen) so that fighting is pointless. It would be better to be more powerful as a warrior and have less all-powerful abilities. It could be also a good idea to specialize through relevant leveling up (either you are a "wizard" type of knight with a lot of power-ups, a "rogue" one with a lot of dashing power, or a "warrior" one so that you can sustain more damage). 

- Leveling up is lame. I got max level (150) in the third or fourth region over maybe twenty or thirty of them, so that at about a fifth of the game. I could have started with max level, it would not have made any difference. This fast progression was due to a broken battle were enemy reinforcements kept coming every twenty seconds with infinite supply, so I could hold them back, but had to few men to win. 

- There can be a lot of lag in the battles especially when many leaders start joining the fight (at the end you are followed by a dozen knights so that you cannot participate to the battle anymore due to intense lag). 

- At some point in game, huge enemy armies (greater than anything you can ever gather) pop up in the middle of the grand strategy map to slow you down. You can defeat them, but it considerably hinder your progress. Lame way to increase the lifetime of the game.

- At the end, when you claim the last castle (a battle which is the very opposite of epicness), the game is not over ! Some regions you had re-conquered suddenly turn to the adversary again. Nothing challenging here, since you have many knights by that time. It is only yet another artifical trick to make the game last still longer than it should have. 

Overall I wouldn't have played this game more than two or three hours if not for the achievement hunting.

34523256.review:
Hyper Knights is a cross between a button-mashing action game and RTS. Think Dynasty Warriors mixed with One-Finger Death Punch, and elements of Galactic Conquest, and you'll have a pretty good idea as to how this game works.

The goal of the game is to recapture your kingdom from "the enemy". They have no name, but they sure do love to be jerks. Start by retaking villages and outposts, then move on to the castles, where you'll be able to reclaim an area of land for you to use in future campaigns. Win battle and kill enemies to gain XP, which will allow you to purchase new upgrades, abilities, and enhancements for your character and army.

The game's mechanics are, as I said, like a cross between Dynasty Warriors and OFDP, with the overworld having the GalCon mechanic of supplying troops to nodes for protection. Each unit type has a specific button combination you need to hit in order to kill them. Don't feel like hitting all those buttons, though? You could always use your nifty powers to clear out a line of soldiers, inspire your troops to kill the enemy faster, or go "Super Self" (the game's version of Super Saiyan, which, in all its button-smashing goodness, is fun as all get out), and decimate the enemy's units before laying the smackdown on that traitorous scum leading them.

Just as each unit has a combo of button to press, so too do the enemy leaders (or knights). In order to deal damage to them, you must circle around them to an open area (basically wherever there isn't a blue cone), hit that combo, and you'll damage them. They're tough, annoying, and they'll use some of their own abilities to either slow down your men, or buff their own. It's important to eliminate them ASAP, otherwise your men will be too distracted by the knights to fight off other units, or destroy buildings and gates during sieges.

The game's overworld is split into various portions, in which you'll find villages, outposts, and castles. Each can provide gold for your kingdom to use, troops for you to recruit, and allied knights that will follow orders, and even move to assist you in battle. You can also upgrade said buildings, increasing their max garrison level, and increasing production of gold. You can eventually build mines (gold), trebuchets (long-distance harassment, for when you want to weaken an enemy before engaging them, and for when you need a bit of a hand during sieges), and safehouses (extra troop production), which will further improve your economy.

The game's AI, as hinted at above, will also try to assist you, or hinder you. During a battle, the overworld map continues to exist, meaning troops' movements and other battles play out in real time. If you open your map during a battle (from where you can also order your four squads around), you can actually see what's happening on the overworld, and even see which units are getting close to you (the HUD during battle also displays timers and numbers for incoming friends and foes). It helps in deciding whether or not you need to retreat, or try and rush the battle, before you get overrun. Allied knights can also be told to guard certain parts of the map, or attack them. This makes pushing or holding an area fairly simple. Up to 13 knights (as of my completion of the game) can be hired and commanded, who will then choose to attack enemies, and return to friendly territory to replinish troop numbers.

Speaking of being overrun, I've yet to even mention the best (and most hilarious) part about this game: You can have 100's and even 1000's of units on the field. It makes for epic moments, especially when you're outgunned, and need to pull off a risky tactic to try and turn the tide of battle in your favor. There's even an achievement for winning a battle when outnumbered 3-to-1! Did I also mention there's a NG+ option? No? Well, you know now.

Of course, this wouldn't be a review without some good 'ol fashioned pros and cons.

Pros

+ Simple art style is charming and easy on the eyes
+ Game mechanics make for some hectic button mashing goodness
+ Battles are sometimes very intense, with the result depending on your choice of actions
+ Workshop support means being able to create your own weapons, armor, and knights. GoT anyone?
+ Controls are very simple, and very easy to get used to.
+ Random enemy infiltration events keep you on your toes, meaning you always need to think before making a move
+ Online Co-op and PvP means you can take on your friends

Cons

- While stupidly fun, the game can get fairly dull after a few hours. I managed to complete the campaign in just under five hours, and just started up a NG+ to see what elese there is to do, and see how quickly I can finish the map.
- AI will sometimes not even try to intercept enemy groups, meaning you can very well expect to lose a few nodes (and even territories) because of it.
- "Super Self", while fun to use, is rather broken. If you know how to do it, you can easily clear out, say fifty units in under ten seconds. Of course, SS is meant for trying to turn the tide in your favor, or quickly eliminate enemy knights.
- The workshop is sort of barren. Not very many interesting items are on there currently, though I could very well be mistaken.
- The campaign is awfully short. As I said, I managed to complete the game in less than five hours.
- A "Challenge" DLC exists. While I understand devs need to fund development for current and future projects somehow, it doesn't really make much sense to add challenges, which can extend the life of a game, as a seperate DLC.

Honsetly? At $5, this game is pretty fun. It's a great way to kill some time, or play with a friend online. With elements of RTS, hack 'n slash, and grand strategy all rolled into one package, Hyper Knights is certainly worth having a look at.

このゲームのイメージを伝えろと言われたら”ゴチャキャラシリーズ＋無双”です。
シルバーゴーストやファーストクイーン、ダークセラフィムなどのゴチャキャラシリーズにハマった方なら懐かしさとともに、特に楽しく遊べると思います。
仲間のナイトと共に奪われた領土奪還を目指すアクションストラテジーですが、ストーリーらしいストーリーはなく、戦略パートで拠点の強化・作製、味方ナイトの配置を行い、アクションパートでコントローラーが壊れそうになるぐらい連打するゲームです。

1週目クリアまでの感想になりますが、アクションゲームのプレイヤースキルはそんなに必要ないです。
一番苦労するのは、ナイトを雇ったり、拠点を強化するためのお金が十分にない序盤の段階で2正面・3正面作戦を強いられることですが、そこを乗り越えるとあとはサクサク進みます。

敵の大群に単身乗り込んで、スーーパーーーーースラッーーーシュ！
敵兵士たちが消し飛ぶ様はなかなか爽快です。ミニマップから敵が一気に消える・・・。
では、自分がゴリゴリ行って敵を倒してればいいだけかというとそうでもなく、味方の兵士数がゼロになるとそのアクションパートは敗北になってしまうので、味方の兵士大事。(むしろ自分は何度死んでもリスポーンする)
敵の城や村などを破壊するのも味方兵士しか行えず(一部スキル除く)、また、突然変異のような鬼つよ敵ナイトの相手をするときには味方と一緒に囲んでボコる必要があります。

おまけ要素として、ワークショップにおいてあるスキンを使ってキャラの着せ替えもできます。
敵・味方ナイトの名前にsteamフレンドの名前が勝手に使われるのもユニークで楽しいです。

悪い点としては。
上にも書きましたが、中盤以降はサクサク進み、終盤は完全にヌルゲーです。
味方ナイトに攻撃させとけばドンドン落としていきます。
待て、オレが行くまで待て。
砦と村を攻撃するときは味方に行先を指示できますが、城攻めと野戦では指示できないため、敵ナイトが変なとこにスタックすると殴りながら味方のところまで押していかないといけません。
普通にすべてのスキルが取れてしまうので、キャラビルドの楽しみはないです。

セールじゃなくてもワンコイン。
自分は十分に楽しめました。

할만한 버튼연타 무쌍 게임

우리팀 병력으로 적의 마을, 성을 침략하여 정복해나가는 땅따먹기 게임입니다.
기본적으로 한글화도 되어 있고 인터페이스도 나쁘지 않습니다.

전투의 경우 상당히 재미있는 편이지만, 똑같은 방식이기에 많이 할 수록 질립니다.
그리고 패드로 안하고 키보드로 플레이 하였는데, 하다보면 손가락이 아플 때가 많습니다.
두 가지 요소 때문에 길게 즐기기 좋은 게임은 아니고, 짧게 킬링타임으로 하기 괜찮습니다.

난이도의 경우 특이한 점은 별다르게 보이지 않고, 하면 할 수록 적의 물량이 많아지거나 지원이 많이 오는 식입니다.
맵의 경우도 너무 평범합니다. 진행하면서 맵이 변화하여 용암맵, 얼음맵이라던지 특이점을 두었으면 흥미가 생겼을 것 같습니다.

버그도 간간히 있고, 하면 할 수록 흥미가 떨어지는 게임입니다.

하지만 기본적으로 전투에는 재미가 있고, 콤보를 넣는다거나 버튼을 연타하면서 스트레스를 풀 수 있기 때문에
짧은 시간동안 즐기기는 좋은 게임이 아닌가 생각됩니다. 가격도 싼 편입니다.

킬링타임용, 단순하고 가벼운 게임을 찾는 분께 추천드리고 싶습니다.

34087557.review:
[h1]Resumo: É um jogo legal pra curto prazo, porém com MUITO POUCO TEMPO se torna chato e repetitivo, mas apesar disso eu recomendo que comprem e deêm uma olhada.[/h1]

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1103623171

Hyper Knights coloca o jogador na pele de um lorde que perde o território. Para recuperar o que lhe fora roubado terá de juntar o seu pequeno exército, derrotar os terríveis Knights e enfrentar vários desafios.

O desafio principal é o de manter as conquistas, uma vez que, os Knights inimigos estarão sempre a atacar as secções do mapa capturadas. Desta forma é possível que o jogador regresse de uma pausa para descobrir que o previamente conquistado fora recapturado. Os Knights são uma espécie de “boss” que se movem de forma independente pelo mapa. Eles defendem e atacam as áreas para as quais estão destacados, podendo ainda auxiliar nas batalhas de captura das aldeias, outposts e castelos, necessárias à conquista das secções.

O jogador pode adquirir Knights inimigos conforme vai avançando no mapa, colocando-os à defesa ou ao ataque. Para além destes, o exército pode ser aumentado pela compra de skills e de mercenários. Chegamos ao primeiro e único recurso do jogo, o ouro. Ganho pela participação em batalhas e pela conquista, ele serve principalmente para adquirir mercenários e fazer upgrade ás aldeias, outposts e castelos.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1103624254

Curiosamente a independência dos Knights e a forma como os soldados permanecem em movimento (sendo transferidos de local em local para preencher as falhas após um ataque ou depois de um dos Knights ter recrutado soldados em falta), tornam Hyper Knights numa experiência dinâmica e viva. Apesar de ser singleplayer, o título transmite uma sensação de cooperativismo entre as várias partes do exército, como se todos trabalhassem para o mesmo fim. O lorde fica então encarregue da maioria dos ataques mas também de proteger secções recém-conquistadas e que ainda não possuem grande número de soldados, e de contratar mercenários, entre outras funções igualmente importantes.

Quanto ao gameplay, este é focado em combinações de botões/teclas. É preciso ter contudo atenção na recomendação do comando para jogar pelo que com o teclado a movimentação é mais difícil, especialmente pela inexistência da seta do rato. Regressando aos ataques, cada combinação corresponde a diferentes acções e skills, incluindo recuperação de HP, ataques aoe e stun, entre outros. Com o avançar no mapa, derrotar Knights e soldados inimigos requer combinações mais elaboradas.

Sendo o único com respawn, ataques especiais e elevado HP, o lorde tem de liderar e proteger os seus homens. Nos outposts e nas villages, por exemplo, o jogador tem de escolher quais as áreas a atacar primeiro, destacando unidades para determinadas partes do mapa. Durante os conflitos é importante também escolher Knights para auxiliar na batalha e garantir uma vitória já que os Knights inimigos farão o mesmo.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1103624639

No final, o campo de batalha pode chegar a um total de 400/500 soldados (ou mais), tornando Hyper Knights numa experiência bem legal, ao som de uma energética banda sonora. Eu esperava um modo online, ai sim seria muito bacana e_e

[b]Créditos[/b] [url=http://www.magazine-hd.com/apps/wp/hyper-knights-analise-critica/]MagazineHD[/url]

33936499.review:
Un jeu vraiment sympathique de premier abords, mais qui devient très vite beaucoup trop répétitif et on a vite fait le tour de se qu’il y a à y faire.

Votre héro devra reprendre un château dont il a été exclu mais la partit ne se termine vraiment que si vous contrôlez toute la carte.
Carte composé d’un certain nombre de région, composer de fort de village et d’un château. Il faut d’abord détruire les villages et fort pour prendre le château, et bien sûr, il faut prendre le château pour contrôler la région.

Pour se faire votre héro disposera de compétence, d’une armée, et du recrutement d’autre chevalier pour attaquer ou défendre, avec l’amélioration des villages forts et châteaux, et quelque construction externe qui ne change pas grand-chose.

Le problème est que votre héro obtiendra sont level max (150) dès quelque heure de jeu à peine, pour finir avec toutes ces compétences au max. Du coup peut importe les compétences qu’on monte et dans quel ordre, vu qu’à terme on aura tout et rapidement.

Le gameplay est vraiment très simple (baser sur deux touches à appuyer dans le bon ordre pour tuer les ennemis), masher les deux touches, se soigner souvent et abuser de quelque compétence assez pété et c’est réglé. Non seulement vous ne perdrez pas souvent, mais en plus la manière de faire sera toujours pareil. Perdre dans se jeu fait juste perdre du temps, mais ça n’est jamais grave, il suffit en deux secondes d’aller chercher une nouvelle armez dans vos bâtiments pas loin et revenir, et c’est repartit de plus belle. Ceci dit le gameplay reste sympathique et fonctionne très bien.
La seule stratégie du jeu tien sur la façon dont on va conquérir la map et se qu’on va faire de nos chevaliers, entre défendre telle zone à soit ou attaquer telle zone adverse, mais c’est très simple aussi. On comprend très vite comment s’y prendre et on fini par avoir bien assez de chevalier pour ne jamais rien perdre, se qui permet de s’occuper tranquillement de l’attaque et même en défense ils arrivent à prendre des régions sans nous.

Au final le gros problème du jeu c’est que, quoi qu’on fasse, c’est juste une question de temps, et c’est toujours la même chose. Faite quelque combat et prenez quelque région, et vous avez fait le tour du jeu. 

Au début j’ai bien aimé le jeu, et le fait est qu’il est très bien les premières heures, mais je me vois obliger une fois fini de lui mettre un avis négatif, car au final si j’avais su, franchement je ne l’aurai pas acheté.
Après ça reste mon appréciation personnelle avec mes propres gouts, peut être que ça gênera moins d’autre personne. D’ailleurs je comprends très bien que le jeu soit si bien noté, mon avis sert plus à modéré cette note que la contester.

全成就了来写一下评测

这是一个非常魔性的小游戏，但是游戏时间并不是很长，有卡，建议打折入。

成就并不难，打的好一点大概四到五小时即可全成就通关。

Прекрасный теплый летний день. Солнышко светит, птички поют. Ты весело бежишь по травке в своих новых кольчужными носочках с мечом за спиной. А потом врываешься в толпу врагов на гиперскорости как Саурон, рубя всех в кровавые ошметки.

Никогда бы не подумал, что Mount&Blade можно удачно превратить в кнопочный слешер. Возглавляем войско, нанимаем лордов-рыцарей, грабим караваны и деревни, берем замки, нанимаем войска и так по кругу, пока не отвоюем все королевство. Сражения ощущаются действительно как сражения. Можно собрать 200 человек под своим командованием и устроить бойню свыше 500 человек с подкреплениями. Есть даже подобие приказов. Рядовых солдат рубим на автомате, над боссами-рыцарями немного трудимся. Есть веселые, кровавые комбо и гипер-рывки. Все просто и со вкусом, и за 100 рублей.

Желателен геймпад. Музыка могла быть разнообразней, единственная мелодия в множестве битв приедается.

33823924.review:
Jogo testado e zerado: Hyper Knights - 2017
Pontuação geral do título: 
8 de 10
Considerações finais: Recomendado em full price ou com desconto de 10%.

Pontos altos do jogo:

1:  Gênero: O jogo é baseado na estratégia com elementos de Hack & Slash em 2D.

2: Longevidade do jogo: O jogo dura cerca de 10 horas + se você for do tipo que conquista tudo no jogo e acaba construindo e recrutando todos Knights para se juntar a sua luta. As conquistas são faceis de se obter o que é bastante legal para os que não tem paciência para pegar todas ou até mesmo para os platinadores de plantão. Depois de terminado o jogo já não vamos ter tanta vontade de jogar o modo New Game + já que é mais do mesmo só que agora com seu personagem no nível máximo e com tempo, mesmo mapa, mesmas coisas. A longetividade do jogo é na sua campanha principal que é muito bem construída e intuítiva. Os elementos de RPG e estratégia são simples e fáceis de aprender. É claro, faltou profundidade nos elementos de estratégia como dominar os castelos inimigos, as torres inimigas e as aldeias inimigas que foram tomadas de você. A inteligente artifical do jogo é muito boa também. Porém, você sabendo administrar bem os lugares já tomados por você e recrutar Knights para se juntar a sua causa de trazer de volta sua terra tudo se torna bastante mais fácil e não oferecendo tanta dificuldade assim. 

Narrativa: Somos um Knight onde temos que recrutar soldados e outros guerreiros (Knights) para se juntar a nossa causa e tomar de volta o que é nosso, nossas terras e castelos. O enredo é basicamente este e para a proposta do jogo está perfeito, já que vamos direto ao ponto e o importante é tomar as terras que foram tomadas pelos inimigos e concluir o jogo. 

Interface: Simples, limpa e bonita. 


Gráficos, ambientação: Ambientação muito boa e gráficos em 2D muito bonitos, com a capacidade de personalizar o seu personagem atráves do jogo, podendo escolher seu nome, armaduras e armas (também do workshop da steam) os gráficos combinam extremamente bem com o jogo e são muito bem feitos, nada coloridos e nem o mapa é tão colorido e com vida, tudo é muito simples mas extremamente eficaz e feito com carinho pelo desenvolvedor. Acabamos por ver Knights inimigos bem diferentes e com habilidades diferentes e podemos até mesmo personalizar eles, também temos cenários diferentes: As aldeias são diferentes dos castelos, temos comboios, fortalezas e vilas para tomar de volta para nós, tudo isso bem ambientado e gráficamente no ponto. Sem maiores problemas aqui.

Música: Combinando perfeitamente com o jogo, de fato pode ser um pouco repetitiva já que vamos escutar mais barulho de espadas e inimigos do que qualquer outra coisa, mas não tira o fato de que foi bem construída dentro da proposta do jogo e não chega a enjoar.


Pontos negativos/fracos:

1. Jogabilidade: A jogabilidade no teclado é demasiada complicada para fazer os poderes especiais do seu Knight, usando basicamente as teclas: Z,X,C e para controlar o personagem as teclas WSAD. Com o tempo você acaba por acostumar mas mesmo assim deveria ser melhor trabalhada pois alem de cansar ficar esmagando os botões do teclado durante as batalhas, na hora dos combos a coisa fica realmente complicada. Outro ponto negativo é que depois que desbloqueamos todas as skills do personagem e também as outras coisas para adicionar pontos o jogo fica relativamente facil até mesmo no teclado. Tira a diversão? não, justamente porque o jogo é curto e definitivamente no ponto de não tornar enjoativo. Mas é óbvio que foi feito para se jogar no teclado do qual é bem melhor e o desenvolvedor do jogo já avisa logo no começo do jogo: Controle recomendado. Mesmo assim tive uma experiência boa no teclado após aprender, afinal depois de aprendemos um dos combos mais especiais do jogo com os pontos que gastamos para implementar tudo no jogo, o jogo se torna demasiado facil mas ainda sim divertido, boa variedade de combos e todas bem implementadas, os Knights inimigos também tem suas skills e alguns bem complicadinhos de derrotar. Mais sobre a jogabilidade: Quando conquistamos qualquer coisa, ela vai continuar crescendo e podemos aumentar sua eficiencia e até mesmo botar artilharias com dinheiro do jogo, assim nos dando mais knights e aumentando nossas defesas. Também contratamos Knights em cada castelo, assim se aliando a sua luta e também podendo acompanhar o jogador o que as vezes dependendo da habilidade deles podemos juntar até mais de 1000 soldados em campo de batalha.

Level Design e balanceamento: Muito bem feito, as batalhas ocorrendo com milhares de inimigos e seus knights é divertido de ver, muito sangue na tela você irá ver e muitos combos legais. Já o balanceamento do jogo depois que você pega a maneira de jogar, basta usar apenas um combo e tudo se torna demasiado fácil para você pois você jogador basicamente destroi todas unidades inimigas (ou quase todas, já que temos batalhas de 500x500 as vezes ou até mais, o que deixa o jogo um pouco mais complicado) mas no geral, usando apenas um combo derrotamos milhares de soldados inimigos e tomamos a aldeia, castelo, comboio, torre ou da maneira que você deseja falar.

IA: Boa inteligencia artifical dos inimigos e do seus companheiros, falhas as vezes e depois de pegar a maneira de jogar fica fácil, mas no começo tu sente que a IA dos inimigos é bem desenvolvida.

Bugs, polimento: O jogo é muito bem polido e o desenvolvedor é bem ativo com a comunidade. Porém, existe um BUG gravíssimo do qual quando temos mais de 500 unidades nossas ou podendo chegar até 2000 mil unidades o jogo cai de maneira drástica a frame rate, batendo os 5FPS, praticamente impossível de jogar e olha que eu ainda consegui ganhar batalhas enormes assim. Porém, foi extremamente irritante e o desenvolvedor já me respondeu dizendo que é algo impossível de corrigir devido a engine (acredito eu) então evite andar com muito Knights ao seu lado e também recrutas que você pega das aldeia, castelos e tudo mais que você dominou. Este é um bug grave, mas por isso a recomendação, não faça como eu e leve Knights contratados em castelos (que são poderosos) e que podem trazer juntos milhões de cavalheiros porque vai passar raiva como eu passei, mas no final das contas é até divertido ver aquele sangue todo colorindo um pouco da ambientação sem muita cor do jogo.

Notas finais: Hyper Knights é um jogo bem polido e com poucas falhas, ambientação bonitinha, gráficos em 2D bonitos, controles um pouco mal feitos no teclado mas bem feitos no controle, combates frenéticos, um pouco de mistura de estratégia e administração das suas unidades e castelos e tudo mais o que o jogo pode oferecer dentro do seu mapa que é de tamanho médio para este tipo de jogo. Hyper Knights é o típico jogo que me divertiu muito e é realmente viciante a ponto do jogador não largar o mesmo até tomar suas terras e dominar todo mapa novamente e destruir completamente seus inimigos e vencer o jogo. A campanha dura bem para o preço do jogo e logo após pegar todas conquistas e vencer o jogo vamos liberar o modo New Game + que acaba por não oferecer nada demais, apenas seu personagem em nível máximo, com contagem de tempo e mais do mesmo o que acaba não estimulando o jogador a prosseguir e dominar novamente TODO mapa já que depois da campanha finalizada o jogo sim, vai se tornar extremamente enjoativo jogar tudo novamente. Lembrando: A conquista New game + é liberada apenas se clicar em iniciar New game + então não se preocupe com o fato de ter que re-jogar todo o mesmo mapa para obter uma conquista, o que seria extremamente ridículo na minha opinião já que nada muda. O multiplayer é vazio, então você deve convidar amigos para jogar junto (o que deve ser divertido) caso contrário poderá sair extremamente satisfeito com o modo campanha que dura na medida certa para o jogador. É claro que lá pelo final as coisas ficam faceis e o jogo já começa a enjoar, mesmo assim eu recomendo totalmente!

Me divertiu e muito!

33798213.review:
Okay, wo fangen wir an?
Was hat mich zum Kauf bewegt? Ich weiss es ehrlich gesagt nicht mehr, war vermutlich eine Mischung aus Empfehlung+exzellente Bewertungen und reduzierter Preis im Summer Sale.
War es das wert? Als Ersteindruck: nein. Das Spiel überfordert erstmal Spieler wie mich die kein Gamepad besitzen (wird auf der Shopseite aber darauf hingewiesen, bin nur schwer belehrbar), da irgendwie alle Tasten scheinbar willkürlich vertauscht festgelegt sind (z für schließen, r für beenden, Leertaste zum bestätigen, Esc+Enter tun nichts, ...). Nachdem man alles umbelegt hat stellt man fest, dass die ursprüngliche Belegung gar nicht so dumm war und versucht sich an den ersten Schlachten. Ohne Fähigkeiten laufen die aber erstmal sehr unspektakulär ab und das Spiel landet für 2 Wochen in der Ecke. Danach gewinnt die Neugier und die mangelnde Akzeptanz das investierte Geld abzuschreiben und der Zweite Versuch beginnt: und HOLY MACCARONI macht das süchtig...
Das stumpfe Geschnetzel wird wesentlich spannender sobald man rausfindet, wie man Fähigkeiten benutzt und was die lustigen Balken unter der Lebensanzeige machen. 
Es vergehen ca. 8 Stunden ohne dass ich Notiz davon nehme.
Das Spielprinzip besteht aus einer Strategiekarte, auf der man seinen Helden bewegt, Streitkräfte (3 Arten) für Geld anheuert (in Städten und Siedlungen), feindliche Stützpunkte angreift, hier wechselt das Spiel in den Schlachtmodus und man kämpft selbst an forderster Front und kann seiner Armee grob Befehler erteilen. Nach Sieg oder Niederlage geht es auf der Weltkarte weiter und man schlägt sich mit seinem Geld durch, sammelt nach jeder Schlacht Erfahrung, investiert diese in bessere Fähigkeiten und passive Skills und irgendwann wird Geld zur Überflussware und die Gegner auch deutlich stärker ohne, dass man seine Hunderttausende irgendwie sinnvoll einsetzen könnte. 
Ziel des Spiels ist die Eroberung der ganzen Karte, woran einen die Ggner aber sehr beharrlich hindern, indem sie eroberte Regionen zurückerobern und das ganze entwickelt sich zu einem mühsamen Tauziehen wenn man nich strategisch Regionen vom Nachschub abschneidet. 
Gegen Ende wird das ganze etwas zäh und man ist irgendwie erleichtert, dass es vorbei ist und wundert sich, wieso man das Spiel am Anfang schwer fand als alle gefühlten Lategame-Schwierigkeiten noch nciht vorhanden waren.
Hätte ich gewusst, was hinter dem Spiel steckt, hätte ich locker das zehnfache dafür ausgegeben. Ich empfehlen jedem den Kauf, bevor die Entwickler mehrken, wieviel Potential ihr Spiel hat.
Denn den Koop-Modus hab ich noch nichtmal getestet

33479565.review:
游戏模式很有趣，玩家控制一个英雄带兵攻打敌方据点并保护己方据点，直到占领全地图来获胜。战斗时需要根据对方单位头上出现的按键来按下对应的键，以此来进行击杀或者造成伤害。但并不是传统的打字游戏，反而非常的有操作感，能让你充分体验无双的快感。
游戏内的元素也比较丰富，玩家控制的英雄单位可以通过升级来获得属性点和技能点来加强属性和解锁、升级技能。还可以招募最多15个可升级的友方英雄来协助战斗。据点也可以通过升级来进行强化，还可以在大地图上建造三种不同的地图建筑来获得额外优势。
游戏的缺点在于，地图是固定的而不是随机生成，玩家控制的英雄也只有一种，拥有的技能都是固定的。一旦通关一次之后，除了解锁剩下的几个成就，就不会有太大的兴趣重复游玩了。但总体来说，这绝对是一款值得一玩的小游戏。
PS：以上评价只针对单人游戏，多人游戏完全没人玩的样子，除非拉上你的好基友。

33418855.review:
Take everything you love about Mount & Blade then hit it with a shrink ray and you’ve got Hyper Knights. Intrigued? I know I was when I heard about this little gem. Truthfully, Hyper Knights came out of left field but it quickly became a bit of an obsession for me. I started playing and suddenly hours had passed. My fingers hurt but half the map was mine!

There are obviously key differences between this game and its forefathers. Mount & Blade is far more engrossing, complex, and skill based. Hyper Knights on the other hand is easy to pick up and play, quick, and combat is very simplistic. Sometimes you want that simplicity and fun, other times you may be craving something more.

If you are craving something deeper then you have a buffet worth of games to enjoy. If you are like me and sometimes want some mindless slaughter and light tactics, pickings can be slim.(Outside the mobile market.) I haven’t found a game that I can enjoy like this since playing Gemfire, an old Sega Genesis game.

Oh and if you do have any suggestions there is a comment section. Feel free to share.

Hyper Knights has two primary game modes, the map and combat map. Sound familiar?

Story is super light but basically Red guys took all of your Blue lands. Time to raise up an army and lay down a medieval butt kicking. Beyond that, the game is all about territory control and gaining/losing ground. The world map is where you move your personal army about and make territory improvements. Each territory has three kind of nodes, village, castle, and keep, each with three levels of upgrades to make them more efficient/produce/stronger. It’s a simplistic economy that becomes very important as you progress.

Villages make gold that the castle needs to make troops. Gold can’t be transported without troops. While it does need a bit of a jump start, it runs efficiently long as no enemies get in the way. Keeps are there just to serve as strongholds and make conquering a territory difficult. The castle is the last node that can be taken before it switches the territory to the other side, which makes keeps very useful.

Keep in mind that you aren’t doing all of this alone. While you choose what to improve, the game generates “Roamers” who serve as a light defense and help run the economy. You can also recruit Knights who serve as generals and are far better at combat. These Knights can be assigned to defend/attack and level up just like you do. The beauty of these systems is that it took longer to write out then it does take grasp it when playing. It’s super simple and works really well.

The only gripe I have is that there is currently only one world map to conquer. Hopefully new content is on the way to change things up occasionally. Another slight issue I had was with the enemy itself. They have the entire map filled out at the beginning of the game. At times it feels like you’re only alive because the game is merciful and just doesn’t send everything at you. On the flip side, this gives the game a bit of a manic feeling with one territory capture leading to bigger and bigger fights.

I wouldn’t mind an option for both armies to start with one territory and build towards each other. Running raids, surprise attacks, etc.

Now all that strategy/territory is nice but the heart of the game is the combat. Hyper Knights is best played with a controller and thankfully does have controller support. Just like M&B depending on what or where you’re attacking is going to alter the combat map. Raiding a castle requires destruction of gates, and eventually the throne. Raiding a village requires burning it down. Same applies for convoys, keeps, etc.

Your character has combos, stuns, basic attacks, and dashes. Basic attacks are going to make your fingers bleed by pressing the X and Y button repeatedly in certain combo combinations to kill enemies. As an example archers require Y-Y-Y and melee attackers X-X-X but as you fight Knights and more advanced enemies these begin to change up rapidly. Requiring more complicated combinations and punishing you with damage for you not getting them correct.

While stuns and dashes are self explanatory, combos are equivalent to using special powers. You gain skill points and combo points as you successfully attack your enemy. Skill points enhance passives like health, army size, and troop strength. While combo points unlock Super Slash, an attack that kills everything in sight. At first you only have access to healing and spike which is a basic attack.

Not to worry though as you are given more than enough points to master all skills/combos as you brutally murder your enemies. The combat, just like the world map, is super easy to grasp and it doesn’t take long to get into the action. There are more fine details such as squads, and Knight’s shields, and second breaths but it’s all to enhance that combat. Not to mention the random events that can occur. Sudden surprise attacks from within, all nodes becoming crippled to name a couple.

Overall the combat is a blast and watching the battlefield become red after a Super slash is fantastic. The only problem lies in the late game, it can be a bit of a slog when you start throwing six hundred vs six hundred. You become heavily dependent on those combos and may break your x and y button. Battles for castles become tiring, as more and more enemy reinforcements arrive. The challenge doesn’t really escalate but it feels more annoying than threatening. The AI is incredibly dumb and you can wipe out whole armies by yourself. Just keep your army safe and away and go to town.

Hyper Knights goes the extra mile and offers some customization. While not the most extravagant of choices, you can swap out weapons, helmets, and chest armor. The cherry on top comes in the form of Steam workshop support. Suddenly, you could be a medieval knight swinging a lightsabre. Hyper Knights has picked up some good buzz so hopefully more will come from the community itself as well.

Hyper KnightsThe graphics are cute and serve exactly the purpose they need to get the point across. I personally liked little touches like enemy Knights getting an introduction and raising their arms up. The only suggestion I would have for the developer would be to add some more absurd humor to the game, as it just kinda fits. Other than that, I have no issues with the graphics at all. They work very well.

The music and sounds are just about par. I wasn’t terribly impressed but I wasn’t disappointed either. You could play the game just fine with the OST or bring your own tunes. In this particular case it’s going to be personal choice.

Last but certainly not least, Hyper Knights supports Twitch, has Steam cards and achievements. Replay is there but I think once the developer adds more maps it’s going to go through the roof as far as replay-ability. Right now you have one map and that can get repetitive. Each play through can take about two to four hours, but there is a new game+ mode. This mode lets you keep all your levels and combos and serves as a speedrun type of deal.

Hyper Knights isn’t going to revolutionize gaming, but I loved it for what it is.

I haven’t seen many games like Hyper Knights and for that alone I obviously highly recommend this title. For me it falls into this weird section of developers innovating what you know and love ever so slightly to make it feel fresh. Which brings me to my final point. This game costs less than a McValue meal.  Coming in at the low price of $4.99/£3.99 there is really no reason not to add this excellent title to your Steam library.

확실히 재미있고 타격감도 좋으며 무쌍보다는 조금 더 전략적으로 움직여야 하지만 단점도 제법 있습니다.

1. 스킬은 굉장히 강한데 병사들은 많이 약한 무쌍 특유의 단점이 전략을 많이 가립니다.
2. 역시 무쌍과 같이 굉장히 반복적입니다. 중독성은 있어서 계속 하는데 그러면서도 지루하긴 합니다.
3. 이상한 버그들이 몇개 있습니다. 대표적으론 왠지 바다를 걸어오는 적과 우리 기사들이라던가...

3. 스팀 창작마당으로 커스터마이징이 가능합니다. 공각기동대SAC의 모자이크가 압권
3. 도전과제가 쉽습니다.(...)

전체적으로 제법 괜찮고 중독성 있는게임 이에요.

It's very simple but nice game that is set in the middleage. We need to conquer the land by taking it from traitors. There are two parts of game where we can spend time. First one is the world map that is very similar to Mount&Blade one. But the difference is that when we are in battle, the world is alive, it's not set on feeze. The battle is mostly dependent on us. We have our minions that help us (together with knights if we hire them) but they cant do it alone. We fight by pressing specific buttons on the controler or the keyboard. We also have access to skills that help us fight with more problematic amounts of enemies.
I recommend this game to anyone who likes to feel as a leader and powerfull king. 9 nice hours of fun gameplay and 100% achievements, 8.700 enemies killed. Well done to the producer.

I also have some ideas that would make it even better if the producer would like to update the game in the future. 
Firstly I would give something like battle size limit. At the end I had battles like 1600 vs 1000. When the most of the minions spawned the game started lagging and the minions started to walk in circles, even if i showed direction on the map, they were not doing anything with sense. Another thing is the level of character. 150 is max but it's too easy to reach it. I was able to get it after conquering like 6 areas which is like 20% of the map. I would make it harder to get. Next thing are the skills. In the whole game I used like 3-4 skills. Healing, whirlwind, inspire and Super Slash... The rest was completly useless. The good thing would be boosting the rest or nerfing the rest. And last think I didn't like was the power of the guy that defended castles. It sometimes almost impossible to kill him as when I attacked him, I was dying from nothing. I don't know if he has any reflected damage or something, but it was deadly. And they were much more powerful than any other knight that can move on map. Im also curious if there is gonna be multiplayer where 2 or more players can move on the map and help each other, that would be nice! :)
Kind regards and good luck with other games!

32969081.review:
Hyper Knights is a very straight forward, simply designed, fairly well executed little action/strategy game. 

It's gameplay loop centers around an action oriented button masher which has you running around a battlefield slaughtering enemy minions by the dozens, while the strategy part of the game focuses on growing/upgrading your kingdom on a large overworld map.

The best thing I can say about the game is that the action gameplay is fun enough to want to jump in even when I only have a few minutes, while the strategy kingdom building piece is just deep enough to keep me glued to my seat for an entire playthrough.

My only real complaints would be the strategy part can quickly become a steamrolling win if you know what you're doing and some enemy Knights have VERY annoying, almost unkillable perk combinations.

Il est excellent ! On crée son personnage et on doit conquérir divers territoires sur une immense carte. 32833568.review:
[strike]It highly recommends controller support. Doesn't offer PS4 controller support on OSX where it shows up as a generic controller that almost every other game supports with zero hassle or third party software. Gave the develpers plenty of time to reply in the forums.

Nothing.

Going to give them another day and this is going to get a refund.[/strike]



Controller issue has been mitigated. The PS4 controller on OSX currently requires a wired connection to work. Note the game GUI is mouse-less and a controller should be mandatory.

As for the game itself. It’s a very light 4Xish crossed with Mount and Blade with Dynasty Warrior. 

You run around an over map managing your empire, building and renovating, moving your armies protecting and raiding convoys and finding more knights so you can raise more armies. You can’t send messengers so if you want something done on the other side of the map you have to do it yourself. Thankfully mid to late game you have more than enough cash to do what you need in an area in one go.

The combat forgoes the normal conventions for the most enemies as each one has a common button combination that is required to be pressed to do damage with each button representing a point of health(With exceptions). Counterpart Knights have a health bar but damage is applied all the same one button at a time.

The game then again breaks this with super powers. Any damaging power (Again with exceptions) is a one hit kill for anything that isn’t a knight. Stronger powers and stats are locked behind a level wall but you can save your points for those big juicy ones you are going to use all the time and gaining experience is easy and the amount of exp required never increase so you level up faster as the armies get bigger resulting in more kills. There is a cap to this as you will run out of powers to spend points on.

Surprisingly enough the combat is fluid and when you get good enough your normal gameplay emulates a late game superpower. However no matter how good you are without your entirely disposable troops you are nothing as extremely large numbers punishes mistakes harshly as you don’t have a safe zone nor distractions to draw fire away. Also you cannot damage buildings making anything outside of field battles impossible to “Solo”.

[b]There is a “Realm Divide” event so if you know what it is and did’t like it you have been warned.[/b]

It does unfortunately have performance issues in larger battles which is disappointing given far more visually demanding and complex games run better with greater numbers. The AI is fine and I have no complaints with it’s behaviour, it just that there seems to be a bottleneck somewhere even though the game feeds additional numbers in waves. With that said it is only a issue in the largest of battles with multiple armies pouring in 

A small solid game and a steal even at normal price.

[h1]무쌍처럼 보이지만 실은 버튼 연타 게임[/h1]

어딘지 모르게 고전 명작 퍼스트퀸4가 떠오르는 화면 구성에
백을 넘는 적과 아군이 부딪치는 전장속에 홀로 뛰어들어가
적들을 무쌍해버리는 호쾌한 액션감!!
.....을 제멋대로 기대했었지만
사실 이 게임은 원핑거 데스펀치나 팀버맨 같은
연타를 기반으로 하는 투 버튼 액션 게임에 가깝습니다.

기본적으로 적들은 대장과 병사를 불문하고
별도의 체력은 존재하지 않으며 가까이 접근했을 때
표시되는 버튼을 패턴대로( X, X, X 혹은 C, X, C 등) 눌러야만
공격을 받고 사망하게 됩니다. 

게다가 이 게임은 기본적으로 무쌍류 게임이기 때문에
쉴새 없이 몰려오는 적들에 맞춰 버튼을 눌러야 하는데
그러고 있다 보면 내가 X를 누르고 있는지 C를 누르고 있는지
내가 버튼인지 버튼이 나인지 모를 무아지경에 빠지기도 합니다(뻥)

물론 이러한 일반 공격말고도 강력크한 스킬도 존재하는데
사방에서 몰려오는 적들을 쓰러트려 스킬 게이지를 모은 뒤
적진 한가운데로 뛰어 들어 스킬로 적을 휩쓸어 버리는 쾌감은
그래도 역시 무쌍은 무쌍이구나 싶을 정도로 상당히 짜릿합니다.

반면, 전투 외 요소들은 다소 심심한 편입니다.
기본적인 스토리나 고유 캐릭터, 대사 같은 요소는 일절 없으며
징병 > 전투 > 점령 > 성장 > 징병 > 전투 > 점령 ..
의 패턴을 게임 내내 계속해서 반복해서 할 뿐입니다.

덕분에 전투는 상당히 재미있는 편임에도 불구하고
하다 보면 금방 지루해지게 됩니다.
조금만 더 다듬었으면 훨씬 재밌어 졌을텐데 상당히 아쉬운 부분

그래도 짧은 시간 가볍게 즐기기에는 괜찮은 게임입니다.

Good fun - a combination of light strategy and button bashing. 

Inflict damage to the enemy, preventing them from regrouping properly. Hire knights to help defend your realm, capture and upgrade cities to get more soldiers, then sally forth and attack!

You can build a few basic things to aid your cause. In some battles you can direct your armies. You can also invest xp in yourself and your armies. Turn the course of a battle with spells: different spells give different advantages, creating a nice blend of action.

32241440.review:
[h1]Hyper Knights[/h1]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Hyper Knights can be summed as a simplified 2D version of the Mount and Blade games. It is a game which puts you in the command of an army and yourself as the badass king who leads them. The gameplay loop of Hyper Knights is pretty simplistic, most of the enemies you face can be killed by two button prompts: X or C. Some enemies can be killed by three same button prompts or a mix of the two.

 You can also use space for Dashing and F to heal yourself or perform a combo when your combo meter has filled up. The enemies also tend to be only of two types: melee and ranged. 
You can also command your troops to fight alongside you in the battles to take over enemy fortresses. While the initial premise does not seem that interesting,

 Hyper Knights provides enough large scale battles on a small platform to remain fun for sometime without getting overly repetitive. While you are not busy fighting in the real time battles, you can manage your troops and your controlled regions and castles. The castles you control can be given troops to increase their protection or troops can be withdrawn to help you in your various raids. 

When you attack an enemy castle, it shows you the amount of soldiers present in it which helps you decide in attacking or abandoning the raid. In such a case, you can either kill a few roamers which will help you upgrade as well as decrease the enemy castle’s strength.

 The real fun of Hyper Knights starts when you join a friendly knights battle or vice versa. From here you will witness hundreds of mini soldiers clashing against each other while you make your way through the battlefields like this game wants you to be. Since killing enemy soldiers is really easy, it gives you the sense of a king without being too overwhelming.

 You can only do this sort of badassery only while you are surrounded by your troops though as going Rambo against a squadron of enemy troops will make you fodder for the archers. When you die, you are given a proper quick time event with which you can resurrect yourself on the battlefield while failing to do so will respawn you way back to the starting point while your soldiers get slaughtered without their leader. 

Hyper Knights does well to keep things balanced and it keeps turning up the difficulty so that you never get too overpowered but even then, there is very little depth to the game. Take down the scale of the battles and nearly every battle you fight is the same in regards to the gameplay.

 The only difference between fighting roamers and castles is that you have to destroy a few buildings while you are raiding an enemy fortress. Let me correct myself there, your soldiers have to destroy a few buildings as you don’t have the ability to destroy the said buildings.

Regardless of the power you use there is no way your sword does damage to a structure where your soldiers take their own slow time to destroy the buildings. These structures also provide no benefit to the enemies as till the time the gates are closed the enemy remains trapped inside. They don’t fire from the top or anything, they just stand there while your soldiers bash away at the gates.

 Another point to be noted is that since you require soldiers to destroy buildings and there are a few stages where buildings need to be destroyed to gain a victory, if you do not have a soldier left at the end of such a stage there is no way but to replay it all over again. It becomes quite stale after some time and there is no real incentive to keep playing as the story is very negligible. 

[h1]Visuals[/h1]

Personally, I did not like the way Hyper Knights present itself. While my first impressions of Hyper Knights were average, it reuses many assets that it quickly becomes tiresome to the eyes. Even though some of the large scale battles manage to stand out, the bland maps and clunky unit movements make visuals a less impressive package than it could have been.

[h1]Sound[/h1]

Similar to its play style, the soundtrack of Hyper Knights feels like a miniature version of epic sound designs. It is smooth and soothing with light hints of war sound design mixed in subtly. The problem though is the fact that Hyper Knights use the same soundtrack everywhere and like the rest of the game, it also slowly grows boring to hear to.

[h1]Overall[/h1]

Hyper Knights is an enjoyable albeit repetitive romp through miniature army clashes. It has the ability to make you sit down and play it for a few short bursts and that should mostly be what you should be expecting at its price of admission but a lack of depth and the fact that every battle feels the same makes it a loose its steam before it should.

[h1]Rating: 60/100[/h1]


This review was brought to you by [url=www.gamephasis.com]GamePhasis[/url]

32199669.review:
XBOX ONEコントローラーを使用。

[h1]良い点[/h1]

・今作はアクションパートとRTSパートに分かれていて、各パートで別の楽しみがあって飽きさせない。便宜上RTSパートと書いたが、厳密にはこちらが行動しないと敵側も行動をしないのでリアルタイムではない。

[u]アクションパート[/u]

・アクションパートでは戦闘マップに切り替わり、主人公を操作してプレイすることになる。味方と敵側の部隊に分かれ、先に敵部隊を全滅させればこちらの勝ち。拠点争奪戦の場合は敵要塞内に配置された玉座のHPをゼロにすれば勝ちだ。

・プレイヤーユニットは通常攻撃、回避、必殺技、カウンター（スタン）ができる。回避を行うにはスタミナを消費するので連打は禁物。必殺技を使用するには敵を倒していく事で溜まるゲージを消費する。

・戦闘が爽快で雑魚敵は基本的には通常攻撃をしていれば倒すことができるが、必殺技等を使い上手く立ち回ることで素早く敵の戦力を削ぎ、こちらの部隊の損害を減らすことができる。だが、序盤では迂闊に敵陣に切り込むと主人公が死んでしまう場合も。

・主人公のレベルを上げることによって入手できるポイントを使用してステータスの強化や新しい能力、必殺技等を入手することができるというちょっとしたRPG要素もある。ちなみにこれで率いることのできる部隊の最大人員数を増やすことができる。

[u]RTSパート[/u]

・RTSパートでは全体マップで敵の拠点を奪い少しずつ進行していくのが面白い。「次は何処の拠点を奪えば効率的に進軍できるのか？」を考えつつプレイするのはかなりハマる。序盤は特に考えなくても詰まる事は無いが後半からは拠点を奪還されない様に立ち回る必要がある。

・お金の概念があり、これを使用して部隊の人員の増強（傭兵を雇う）や騎士等の強力なリーダーユニットを雇うこともできる。プレイヤーユニット以外も戦闘をしているので、援護をするか、部隊の増強をするか等を考えないといけない。

・奪った拠点は強化することができ、お金の入手量の増加やその拠点に駐留できる部隊の数の増加等ができる。

[h1]悪い点[/h1]

・他の方も指摘しているが、後半は敵の数が増えていく事もありXYボタンの連打が激しくなっていくためコントローラー（キーボード）が壊れそうで怖い。

・リプレイ性は低めなように感じた。

[h1]総評[/h1]
制作陣が「無双シリーズ」や「マウント＆ブレード」シリーズに影響を受けているとのことだが、今作は両作品の良いとこ取りをしたように感じた。爽快なアクションゲームが好きな人は買い。おまけに値段が安いので後悔はしないと思う。

プレイ動画をアップしているので、気になった方は[u][url=https://youtu.be/AL-jDRFnKi8]こちら[/url][/u]を参考までにどうぞ。

32159824.review:
Video:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6y8ugK1OvaM

Plot/Overview:  Kill things with simple combos, raise armies, hire other knights to do your bidding, then conquer the world.  The loop is simple, fight the enemy army with your's and win the day!  

Menus:  The menus are pretty cut and dry as the game isn't really graphics intensive.  You have your resolution options that go up to 4k, full screen toggle, vsync, AA, the option to turn off the gaming running when alt tabbed, language options and the friends names, which will be knights you can hire or fight against while playing.  

There is also Twitch integration which allows your viewers to give you extra gold and experience and name knights after them.

You have seperate sliders for sound and music, as well as a master slider.

All the controls are rebindable from the options menu.

The game supports Steam Workshop integration for armor and weapon sets.

Music/Sound:  The music fits the game, it has a nice mediviel sound to it and the sound effects, while generic suit the game well.



Gameplay:  This is the meat and potatoes of this game, it's a simple gameplay loop of raise armies, fight other armies, raid villages, siege castles, and face other knights in fast-paced combo combat where each unit type requires different combos to take down.  While you can use special abilities to heal or wreak havok on your opponents.  And this is where the game to me becomes monotous and boring as it's the same loop, but you have more knights and you have more combos and skills.

The AI does their own thing and you have limited control of your army, using the map to tell where troops to go, but beyond that, no other control.


Controls:  A controller is strongly reccomended for this game.  And as mentioned above, all the controls are rebindable for your own comfort.


TLDR

Pros:
Simple and addictve gameplay.
Rebindable Keys.

Neutral:
Twitch Integration
Music/Sound

Cons:
Gameplay becomes repetitve.
The game turns in to a grind.
Everything is a QTE
Enemy Knights can become a chore as they focus you.
Limited control over the AI.

这是一个单体技能：对范围内一名敌人造成大量伤害，如果范围内有骑士会优先攻击骑士，耗费一格能量
这个技能点满后，打最强4键敌方骑士，最多用3次就能直接干掉
所以后期单体最强打发：点满Passive combo（缓慢增加能量，点的越多加的越快）， Starting combo：（初始能量，每点一级初始多一格能量，最多4格） 和 Flurry。 这样战斗一开始就有4格能量，可以直接干掉一个4键骑士，如果还有，就先逃跑打酱油，能量攒够，然后继续秒杀。当然这个办法只是为我这种菜鸡准备的，普通办法打实在打不过，太硬了，最蛋疼的是，如果没点passive combo这个技能，你把小兵都杀了后就很难攒能量了，4键骑士很容易打晕你，而且防守范围很大，非常难打

而最强群体技能就是Super Slash了，这个技能需要4格能量释放，效果是消灭范围内所有敌人，这个范围具体有多大暂时还没搞清楚，各位试几次就有大概的感觉了，最好多攒些人再用，效果非常非常爽，我目前的记录是一次砍了130多个人

这个游戏其实还有一些运营和经营的内容，比如升级建筑和造投石车，不过都是一些小升级，期待更丰富的功能

关于扩张领地我的建议是一定不要着急，最好等新打的领地都续上足够的兵力再进发，不然电脑很可能趁着你没兵的空隙直接反推回来，然后就是投石车，我建议连绵不绝的建造，在投石车范围内战斗会有大石头砸敌人，不过好像也会打到自己，有一次我疑似被石头砸死了

另外电脑偶尔也会出些幺蛾子，有一次突然2个300人的敌方部队莫名其妙的绕过前线直接打我最深处的领地，300人的部队啊我去，玩家满级也只能带200人，算上增援将近700人的战斗，电脑都变卡了，终于在丢了一半的地后给打跑了。。。

队友骑士有时候也比较坑，能招的队友数量其实不多，有时候我都觉得防守人不够，但电脑队友贼好战，我就让几个人守一块地，结果过一会一看又给我打了两三个地下来，有时候这样反而会让补给断掉，变得四面楚歌

总的来说是款很有意思的游戏，目前来说内容还不是很多，但如果好好更新的话应该还是很有潜力的，而且现在价格也很便宜，很期待这个游戏后续的发展

Pros:
Easy to Learn, Difficult to Master
Balanced game play that remains fun and challenging
Arcade Style fast paced fighting keeps you on your toes even max level
Strategy elements are simple with huge impact
Fun skill tree allows different approaches to game play.

Cons:
Bugs:  found myself getting stuck at same location during castle siege with infinite hp with enemy captain stuck with same hp problem. You are forced to retreat taking total losses since he can't die and needs to be killed to complete objective.  Additionally I found my captains getting stuck on corners when I order then to take or defend territory that's requires more and a strait line.
Killing Captains becomes a game of using max tier frenzy 2-3 times and late game involves managing respawn timers. Though this Can be fun it gets repetitive after a while with no viable alternative.

Overall:
This is an absolute Gem!  For someone who loves M&B along with Chivalry this game is a fun 2d arcade mashup.  I honestly have had more fun with this game than I did with some of the AAA games such as Fallout 4, Witcher 3 etc.  I would highly recommend getting this game especially since it's listed at only $5!!!  The developers obviously know what is fun and I would like to see more content from this group.

31995742.review:
[h1] Degustação do Jogo [/h1] [b]Hyper Knights - 2017[/b]
[h1] Pontuação[/h1] [b]6 em 10[/b]
[h1] Veredicto [/h1] [b]Recomendado com Desconto[/b]
 
[h1]Pontos Fortes:[/h1]
[olist]
 
[*][b]Género[/b] -  Um 2D Top Down, Hack & Slash com elementos de Estratégia e RPG.
Considero uma mistura engraçada entre o Mount & Blade e o Dynasty Warriors que infelizmente não atinge todo o potencial desta fórmula.
 
[*][b]Longevidade[/b] - Depois de cerca de 20 horas para concluir o jogo com todos os Achievements desbloqueados, o que é bastante bom tendo em conta o custo do jogo, não vi propósito em continuar a jogar pois senti que, para além de já ter visto tudo o que o jogo tem a mostrar, a simplicidade da jogabilidade e a falta de profundidade dos elementos de RPG e de Estratégia não me cativaram e depressa se tornaram repetitivos e monótonos.
Ao terminar, desbloqueia-se o modo “New Game +” que é mais do mesmo, apesar de começarmos com um personagem a nível máximo.
 
[*][b]Narrativa[/b] - Somos um cavaleiro que tem de recrutar mais cavaleiros para reconquistar o reino, e a partir daí é praticamente um jogo mudo em termos de narrativa, mas não importa porque o importante é matar e conquistar!
 
[*][b]Interface[/b] - Simples, limpo e eficaz, tem alguns bugs como por exemplo expandir para fora do ecrã no final das batalhas que têm demasiados cavaleiros envolvidos.
 
[*][b]Gráficos[/b] - Apesar de não considerar o estilo gráfico um ponto forte do jogo, este não deturpou a experiência a ponto de ser considerado negativo. Nota-se um contraste entre personagens e cenários, no sentido em que não existe grande coesão. As unidades são simples e estilizadas, utilizando um código de cores que ajuda a fazer uma distinção do seu tipo e da sua aliança.
 
[*][b]Música[/b] - Aparenta ter uma música para os menus e outra para o combate, apesar de ser limitado neste aspecto não cheguei ao ponto de ter de desativar a música por achar repetitiva ou desagradável.
 
[/olist]
 
[h1]Pontos Fracos:[/h1]
[olist]
 
[*][b]Jogabilidade[/b] - É recomendado o uso de gamepad mas as primeiras horas que joguei foram com teclado e, apesar de ser mais fatigante, é viável para quem não tem outra alternativa. O movimento é livre, os ataques são feitos através de 2 botões que têm de ser utilizados na ordem certa para eliminar os adversários e as habilidades são invocadas também com uma combinação de botões enquanto o jogo fica em modo mais lento. Carregar furiosamente nos botões de ataque é bastante eficaz, sobretudo quando se desbloqueia a habilidade “Super Self” que faz com que qualquer ataque seja letal, e a partir daí o real desafio do jogo é a parte de gestão e recrutamento, pois as batalhas tornam-se relativamente fáceis e muito repetitivas.
 
[*][b]Som[/b] - O que mais iremos ouvir durante as sessões de jogo será o barulho estridente da nossa espada a colidir com os nossos inimigos, o que se pode tornar um pouco ( no meu caso bastante ) irritante. Podia haver alguma variação, até mesmo com base no inimigo que estamos a atingir. 
 
[*][b]Design[/b] - Não considero que o jogo esteja bem balanceado, algo que notei depois da grind inicial até ter alguns cavaleiros e upgrades nas estruturas, a partir daí basta andar com 2 cavaleiros e escolher se queremos atacar ou defender, e ordenar aos restantes para fazer a alternativa à nossa escolha. Assim que o meu boneco ficou a nível máximo, os meus combates foram todos feitos com o “Super Self” e às vezes o “Super Slash”, para dizimar dezenas e até centenas de soldados. Nas primeiras vezes achei graça, mas depois tive de repeti-lo inúmeras vezes até finalmente conquistar o último território em batalhas com muitas centenas de unidades, em que a alternativa seria utilizar as outras habilidades e perder mais tempo e unidades. É interessante o facto de o jogo continuar no mapa, enquanto estamos em batalha, no entanto em batalhas mais longas damos por nós a perder estruturas e territórios sem maneira de o evitar.
 
[*][b]Polimento[/b] - Deparei-me com um bug grave, que surgiu pelo menos 3 vezes, no qual alguns inimigos fugiam para fora do ecrã e eu tinha de procurá-los quase às cegas, seguindo uma seta no canto do ecrã sem a câmara a seguir-me, na esperança de os alcançar e matar. 2 dessas vezes a batalha foi tão longa que eles afastaram-se demasiado e tive de sair e voltar a entrar no jogo pois a batalha não acabava… extremamente frustrante! Tem outros pequenos bugs como os soldados ficarem presos em algumas partes dos cenário e os menus expandirem para fora do ecrã.
 
[/olist]
 
[h1]Notas de Prova[/h1] 
Este é um jogo inspirado em 2 títulos que me são muito, muito próximos, o Mount & Blade e o Dynasty Warriors, e por essa mesma razão não acredito que tenha tirado o melhor proveito desta fórmula. Sem me querer alongar muito, é um jogo divertido para curtas sessões, sobretudo ao preço a que está, e a integração com a Steam Workshop e a Twitch é algo benéfico para streamers e para quem gosta de personalizar o seu personagem com conteúdo cosmético. Infelizmente, não espero voltar a pegar-lhe caso não surja algum update considerável de conteúdo, pois achei demasiado fácil e repetitivo, e depois de atingir o nível máximo com o personagem e desbloquear os achievements todos, perdi completamente a motivação e vontade de continuar a jogar.
 
[h1] 6 / 10 [/h1]

31947842.review:
https://youtu.be/ELy_RXpNTmg

Jeu offert par les devs:
On peut dire ce qu'on voudra, quand un mec te sort "ouais, mon jeu est inspiré de Mount&Blade vient voir", t'es curieux...
Puis, tu lances le jeu et tu vois...alors, oui dans ce jeu la carte est immense et l'objectif est de la conquérir, ça, ça rappelle M&B.

Tu contrôles directement un chevalier qui guide une armée contrôlée par l'IA dans des combats face a des armées qui peuvent être assez gigantesques. A toi d'utiliser ta puissance pour donner un coup de main en attaquant les troupes adverses. Comment tu attaques? Réalise une séquence de bouton, et c'est bon, l'ennemi est mort. répète ça ad nauseam et tu as Hyper Knight. Donc en gros, unn  jeu hyper répétitif avec une boucle de gameplay tellement limitée que le jeu aurait plus sa place sur mobile que sur PC. Ajoute à ça des graphismes pas folichons et une musique ulta-répétitive et t'as pas envie d'aller conquérir la map géante que le jeu te propose.

Dns M&B, t'avais des négociations, de l'achat de matos, des conflits inter-factions...ici...rien...après, ça reste fun à jouer une heure ou deux, le temps de faire quelques QTE et de voir certains pouvoir de ton héros (le héros gagne en niveau et compétence). La carte est dynamique avec des convois, des armées qui se déplacent...mais ça ne sauve pas l'ensemble.

Doit-t-on pardonner à un jeu d'être aussi profond qu'une mare au canard juste parce qu'il est à 5 €?
Non monsieur, pas chez moi! ha, et l'intégration twitch ne devrait pas être l'élément sur lequel se base le jeu pour être fun, c'est juste n'importe quoi.

Désolé les rageux
31947842.developer_response:
Howdy,

Can I ask how far along did you get? From the video it seems you got to level 19 which means you didn't see most of what the game has to offer.

The game has a lot more depth than just smash two buttons to kill the enemies.

You have 11 combos to experiment with, you can raid villages and take over regions, hire friendly knights and give them orders, manage your kingdom by upgrading your nodes and constructing overmap buildings, you have 14 upgrades to enhance your character and every enemy has a unique set a skills including several that completely go against mashing buttons like Riposte where you take damage if you hit the wrong button.

It seems to me quite unfair to compare the features of a $5 game to a $60 game and completely disregard the price difference. I'm very pleased with the features present in Hyper Knights but obviously it is not on the same level as M&B hence the price difference.b

I am planning to continue supporting and updating the game so if you have any specific thoughts let me know. Currently looking into multiplayer viability.

Cheers! 


--------

Howdy,

Puis-je vous demander à quelle distance avez-vous obtenu? De la vidéo, il semble que vous avez atteint le niveau 19, ce qui signifie que vous n'avez pas vu la plupart de ce que le jeu a à offrir.

Le jeu a beaucoup plus de profondeur que de smash deux boutons pour tuer les ennemis.

Vous avez 11 combos à expérimenter, vous pouvez ravir les villages et prendre en charge les régions, embaucher des chevaliers amicaux et leur donner des commandes, gérer votre royaume en mettant à niveau vos nœuds et en construisant des bâtiments surchargés, vous avez 14 mises à niveau pour améliorer votre personnage et chaque ennemi a un Unique définit une compétence comprenant plusieurs qui vont complètement contre les boutons de masquage comme Riposte où vous prenez des dégâts si vous frappez le mauvais bouton.

Il me semble tout à fait injuste de comparer les fonctionnalités d'un jeu de 5 $ à un jeu de 60 $ et de ne pas tenir compte de la différence de prix. Je suis très satisfait des fonctionnalités présentes dans Hyper Knights, mais évidemment, ce n'est pas au même niveau que M & B, donc la différence de prix.b

Je prévois de continuer à soutenir et à mettre à jour le jeu, alors si vous avez des idées spécifiques, faites-le moi savoir. En ce qui concerne la viabilité multijoueur.

31938612.review:
[h1] Hyper Knights – рыцарский симулятор от Endless Loop Studios [/h1]

Hyper Knights это уже третья игра от независимой студии Endless Loop Studio. До недавнего времени Hyper Knights находилась в Раннем Доступе. Но, 19 мая 2017 года Hyper Knights вышла в релиз. Её цена составляет всего лишь 2.99$ в странах СНГ и 129 рублей в России. 

[list]

[*] Мы начинаем наш путь с нашего замка. Нам показывает как его захватывает враг и наши помощники говорят что нам время уходить. В этот же момент нам показывает карту мира и когда-то наше царство, которое захватили вражеские войска. 
В самой первой битве игра нам расскажет о местной механики. Значит так, мы будем использовать клавиши «z» - для одиночного удара, «x» для второстепенного удара, «c» для оглушения врага, а  «f» для использования уникальной способности персонажа, которая будет составлятся из комбинаций этих же клавиш. Но это не обычный slasher как можно было подумать прочитав строчки вверху. Каждый враг имеет свою комбинацию клавиш, использовав которую вы сможете его убить. Например у лучника комбинация из трёх клавиш «X-X-X», это значит что нажав три раза на клавишу «х» вы сможете убить врага, никак иначе, кроме использования уникальных способностей, которые будут наносить урон. 
В игре присутствует около 6-ёх разновидностей рядовых врагов со своими уникальными способностями. Самые обычные из них это лучник, мечник и щитоносец. Как я и говорил ранее у каждого своя комбинация для убийства. Но по мере прохождения игры уровень этих рядовых врагов будет расти, а максимальный уровень обычного врага – третий. На третьем уровне враг получает около 2-3 уникальных способностей, например массового стана или что-то этого. 
Должен упомянуть ещё одну разновидность врагов, которых можно назвать мини-боссами. Это такие же рыцари как и вы. У них так же есть уникальные способности, но в отличии от вас они не могут мгновенно прыгать от врага к врагу, уничтожая сотни вражеских юнитов. Дальше проходя игру враги будут ставать жирнее, быстрее, сильнее. Поэтому на половине игры вы будете всё время в напряжении, ведь враги будут переть со всех сторон света. 
«Как же защитится от них?» спросите вы, не в одиночку ведь. А я отвечу что в игре есть союзники, которых вы сможете нанимать. Как вы захватите новую территорию, то тогда к вам захочет присоединится рыцарь, представляя свои услуги, обычно, за небольшую цену. Вы можете управлять всеми своими рыцарями в особом меню. Вы можете поставить их и на защиту ваших территорий и на атаку вражеских. 
Не могу не упомянуть об прокачке главного героя. Получая опыт за убийства в битвах, игрок сможет потратить поинты улучшений на пассивные улучшения героя, такие как увеличение здоровья, быстрое восстановление стамины во время боя, или же на активные уникальные способности, на «Землетрясение», «Обновление» и многое другое. Максимальный уровень в игре 150-ый, но я скажу что всё равно вам не хватит 2-ух поинтов до полной прокачки пассивных умений персонажа(возможно это баг). 
Особенность захвата территорий заключается в том, что на каждой территории есть как минимум один аванпост(где самое большое скопление вражеских юнитов), одна деревня, а потом уже замок. Сначала нужно уничтожить все аванпосты и деревни, а потом уже идти на замок. Хочу заметить то, что через некоторое время разрушенные деревни или аванпосты восстанавливаются. Ещё есть маленькое дополнение в игре это строительство требушетов, шахт и автономных аванпостов. Каждая их этих строений будут давать свои облегчения в игровом процессе. 

[*] Графическая составляющая в игре такая же как и во всех остальных играх Endless Loop Studio. Абсолютно во всех играх данной студии все персонажи имеют руки отделенные от тела, прям как у персонажа известной франшизы игр Rayman'a. Собственно, оценить графику вы способны сами. 

[/list]

Вердикт: [i]Оригинальная задумка, неплохая реализация этой идеи. Конечно же наличие багов не радует, но зато радует наличие Workshop’a. Через некоторое время игра может надоесть, ведь контента в игре не совсем то достаточно для новой игры+. [/i]

Оценка: [b]7.9/10[/b]. Ещё одна замечательная игра от Endless Loop Studio.

Обзор был составлен Ci8, членом группы [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/bigbadwhl] BigBadWhale Games[/url] в сотрудничестве с [url=http://welovebundles.ru/]WeLoveBundles[/url]

Ключ к игре предоставил издатель, но это [u]никак не влияет[/u] на моё мнение и оценку.

Оценка редакции: 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=706582524

You have 11 combos to experiment with, you can raid villages and take over regions, hire friendly knights and give them orders, manage your kingdom by upgrading your nodes and constructing overmap buildings, you have 14 upgrades to enhance your character and every enemy has a unique set a skills including several that completely go against mashing buttons like Riposte where you take damage if you hit the wrong button.

I am planning to continue supporting and updating the game so if you have any specific thoughts let me know. Currently looking into multiplayer viability.

Cheers!

31904295.review:
リアルタイムに敵味方が行動する全体マップ画面での各ヒーローユニットへの移動指示、ミニオン生産・戦闘支援・資金生産の３種類施設の建設、城や街のアップグレード等の戦略要素と、戦闘画面での大量の敵味方が入り乱れるアクションパートの爽快感が上手く組み合わさった、なかなかユニークなプレイ感覚のゲームです。

2Dアクションパートでは大量に群がる敵をバサバサとなぎ倒してくのですが、敵にはXXXやYYY、YXY等のボタンに対応したHPゲージがあり、対応したボタンを押さないとダメージが通らない仕組み。またAボタンでダッシュ、Bボタンでスタン攻撃ができます。
乱戦の中でターゲットした敵のゲージを瞬時に見極めてボタンを連打していくのですが、AAAYYYYAAYYAAXXXYXYXYAAAYYY！
みたいな感じでクッソ忙しいです。コントローラー壊れる。
敵を倒していくとコンボゲージがたまり、ゲージを消費する事で強力な技を発動できます。
スキルはヒーリングや範囲攻撃、味方へのバフ等11種類ありそれぞれ３段階まで強化可能。
パッシブスキルは移動速度やHPの強化、アーミーサイズの拡大など14種類を３~４段階まで強化可能です。

戦略マップでは段々接地する敵エリアが増えていくので、うまく自陣を防衛しつつ領土を拡大していきましょう。
2時間程のプレイ時間で既に4方面作戦というか四面楚歌というか…なかなか大変な状況。
前線に立ってガシガシ戦っていっても勿論OKですが、味方ヒーローユニットもなかなか優秀なので、移動先を指定しておいて後方から前線へミニオンの輸送等裏方をしていても勝手にエリアを占領してくれたりも。

ボリューム的にはそれほど何十時間もかかる様なゲームではなさそうですが（そんなにかかったら指が死んじまうよ）、値段もお手頃ですしプレイ中はとにかく高いテンションを維持して遊べるので、ちょっと変わったSLGがやりたいなら手を出してみてもいいんではないでしょうか。
楽しいよ。
